instruction: Explain the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on real estate investments and why evolving data and analytics are crucial for understanding performance and risk.
output: The COVID-19 pandemic has hastened secular shifts that were already impacting real estate investment, increasing the need for evolving data and analytics to understand the changing performance and risk drivers. With the double whammy of a rapid economic contraction and accelerated changes hitting parts of the real estate market, investors are faced with fundamental questions about the future of real estate as an investment asset class and sector of the economy. Despite these challenges, climate change remains a critical issue for real estate investors and must be taken into account when considering risk and return. As we look beyond the pandemic, 2021 could be a game-changing year for real estate markets, with changes that may reshape real estate investment.
